column4: Well the proper place to put it is in /home/bin  or /usr/local/bin
But if you want it technically hidden you simply put a period in the front of it.
If you put it in /home/kes0r/bin  you can run it from the command line (regardless of where the terminal is)
ok nvm i think its ok its in home directory anway
put a period in front of it
and do i have to change the command for skype command
A period in front of the filename makes it hidden
If you run 'skype' in the terminal skype will be run normally and this script will be ignored
